intro: Eliokarmos decus-montium, commonly known as the mountain-star ivy, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, star-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery绒毛. The plant produces clusters of delicate, purple-blue flowers that bloom in the spring and early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found growing along rocky outcrops and mountain slopes. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
